Yes, there are rules and guidelines that you should follow while visiting the orangutan rehabilitation center to make sure you respect the animals and their environment. Here are some general guidelines:

1. Stay at a safe distance: Maintain a safe distance from the orangutans and avoid getting too close to them or their nests. 2. Do not feed the orangutans: Feeding the orangutans can disrupt their natural diet and feeding patterns. 3. Do not touch or disturb the orangutan: Orangutans are wild animals, and any attempt to touch or disturb them can be dangerous. 4. Do not litter: Make sure to dispose of your trash properly and do not litter the environment. 5. Follow the rules and regulations: Follow any rules and regulations set by the rehabilitation center, such as sticking to designated trails and respecting quiet hours. 6. Stay with your group: Keep with your group and follow the instructions of your tour guide to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone. By following these guidelines, you can help to protect the orangutans and their habitat, and ensure that you have a positive and responsible experience.
